com.noctarius.replikate

      • onReplaySuspiciousRecordId

        ReplayNotificationResult onReplaySuspiciousRecordId(Journal<V> journal,
                                                    JournalRecord<V> lastRecord,
                                                    JournalRecord<V> currentRecord)

        This callback method is called when during journal replaying a missing recordId or other suspicious events arise.

        The further behavior of the journal replay can be influenced using the callback's result.
        • ReplayNotificationResult.Continue means that execution will be move on with the next record or finish initialization of journal when replay is finished
        • ReplayNotificationResult.Terminate will silently finish the record reading and will only announce the already read entries
        • Finally ReplayNotificationResult.Except will throw a JournalException and none of the already read entries will be announced (same can be achieved by throwing an RuntimeException inside the callback)
        Parameters:
        journal - The journal that is read
        lastRecord - The previously read journal record
        currentRecord - The currently read journal record
        Returns:
        Further execution behavior

      • onReplayRecordId

        ReplayNotificationResult onReplayRecordId(Journal<V> journal,
                                          JournalRecord<V> record)

        This method is called when during startup of the Journal implementation a previous journal was found and records replayed. For every record in the existing journal the callback will be executed.

        The further behavior of the journal replay can be influenced using the callback's result.
        • ReplayNotificationResult.Continue means that execution will be move on with the next record or finish initialization of journal when replay is finished
        • ReplayNotificationResult.Terminate will silently finish the record reading
        • ReplayNotificationResult.Except will throw a JournalException (same can be achieved by throwing an RuntimeException inside the callback)
        Parameters:
        journal - The journal that is read
        record - The currently read journal record
        Returns:
        Further execution behavior
